QdjwIqIyIXnyGdNy5GISXA.text: What a heavenly surprise I walked into this evening. Fifteen minutes before they were closing my eyes were met with delectable treats. I snagged the Coconut Chiffon Cake, Panna Cotta and the Fruit Tart. I could not wait to get home and try them all! As I was heading out the door my eye caught the list of crepes and I knew I would have to give those a go another time. Each dessert was light which was exactly what I was going for. And the flavor was incredible for each! Creamy, silky goodness! I was thoroughly impressed considering their location was in a random parking lot next to a nail salon and a Jiffy Lube. And I've been living 2 miles away for almost 3 years and never thought to stop in. I already cannot wait to go back. And the employees were very nice and never made me feel like I was being pushed out the door even thought I came in close to closing time. Heavenly treats I will be back for.

photos.caption: Photo of SUZUYA Patisserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chiffon Coconut Cake, Panna Cotta and Fruit Tart

snGDOps5JKR4zAsYb6Wmbw.text: A bit far from the strip, but it's worth the drive. Super nice and friendly service. Reasonable prices and tasty pastries!

CowDTvanj5pL7LqEYQYT3A.text: Mmm! Close to home and delicious! Try a banana, strawberry, Nutella crepe with vanilla ice cream. It comes out hot with the ice cream wrapped inside and is so amazing!  The ambiance is wonderful and the staff is very friendly!

Zf0zmWKNF9bTBpaeWW0Log.text: Dropped by here after work and picked up a few treats for home consumption.  The small shop only has seating for a dozen people with the bulk of the floor space devoted to the display cases and kitchen (everything is made on-site).  Since I was there after 5pm, there weren't a lot of items left, but I still snagged an apple pie, a piece of chocolate cake, and a piece of strawberry shortcake.  The thing I most appreciated about my items was that they were not too sweet.  While I am a fan of sugar and buttercream and frosting, I do enjoy tasting the actual ingredients in my baked goods.  The Fuji apples in my little pie were well-spiced and bursting with flavor, providing great textural contrast to the pastry.  Both the chocolate cake and the shortcake featured alternating layers of cream filling and delicate cake; in addition, the robust dark chocolate shavings on the chocolate cake provided tooth resistance and melted satisfyingly on my tongue.  I could taste the quality of the ingredients and the care lovingly put into the products.  Service was friendly and I was thanked for coming in to visit.  How nice!

photos.caption: Photo of SUZUYA Patisserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yumminess!!

gS-6tL8bNXKRHS-uFa6bbg.text: I have been wanting to stop by this place for so long due to the reviews and their specialty in crepes. We got a Millie crepe and I hand crepe. Not impressed with the hand crepe. Paris hotel seem to make better crepes.

ADkZp0gmXwR6jizp_Unhsg.text: Amazing pastries and crepes in a charming little space. The crepes are Japanese style, lighter than French. Went twice last week and had the Rocky Road and the blueberry and cream cheese -- both were great!  Also took away a green tea eclair, which had a lovely delicate flavor, and the tofu cheesecake, which was the perfect texture and also delicious.  Chatted a bit with the owners -- they were very friendly. Judging by the number of customers who came in while I was there, this place won't be a delightful secret for long!

RXBiKLolMscn5CMYMBYAJQ.text: This place is my new obsession.  There go my hopes of dropping weight before the new year.  It started when I just wanted to grab a quick cup of coffee without having to go all the way to Starbucks.  I live in walking distance of this spot so it was very convenient.  While waiting to get my drink, I watched as the guy ahead of me ordered a strawberry-filled crepe that looked and smelled delicious.  My olfactory sense made a mental note and I knew I'd have to make a return trip.  I ended up never even getting a crepe but tried a personal-sized Fuji Apple Pie instead. Lemme tell you when I say, I'm literally a slave to them now.  I find it very hard to resist swerving into the shopping center to check in to Suzuya to see if that wonderful pastry delight is sitting there calling me like a Siren to indulge in its culinary wonderment.  In the last two weeks or so, I've had about 3 or 4.  I even ordered a full-sized one for Thanksgiving and literally prayed that no one would touch it before the night was over.  THANKFULLY, my prayers were answered and I was able to devour the pie all by myself over a course of a few days since Thanks.  (Try it with butter pecan ice cream and you'll be in heaven!)  I just recently tried the Pumpkin Pie and now I'm torn between which is my fave...so I just buy them both. :)   The folks that work at Suzuya are sweet, polite and incredibly gracious providing the kind of hospitality that you only get overseas.  Just going inside, I'm transported to a place and world I've never been to but would now love to visit--Japan!  I count myself a a proud patron of this establishment and wish them all the success in the world.  I'm contemplating stopping by even as I type this... :::grabs keys:::

vVApWLFo6t7bE9skJf-9jQ.text: Driving on a Sunday afternoon when a crepe craving struck.. If you are ever In the Southwest area please do yourself a favor and stop by. We had a banana strawberry and Nutella crepe, strawberry shortcake and cream puffs everything was fresh and tasty the ambience and costumer services is A+ will definitely come back.

zq9JST5E2QCB4D7_hnY-Tw.text: I absolutely love crepes and am a little picky about them since I make them at home. If I am going to buy a crepe it better be darn good... IT WAS!!!!  Super friendly and crepes were amazing! I am excited to try their other baked goods next.

XEQvkhSqx2na84FpnM2_qA.text: Never been to this place but my boss gave me box of assortments that I have no idea what they are and they taste good. After looking through everyone's review I will definitely stop by to try other stuff

79y6O0VSBaPM5Z3H72aKKg.text: Oh my, if you've never been here...these desserts are heavenly! I also had the Ham & Cheese Crepe...super yummy. Such a variety of desserts Japanese inspired, I've never seen or eaten anything like this...a must GO TO place, great place for lunch!!!

c14yhi1USDdturMXNEwajw.text: Awesome!! All the desserts and crepes we had were so good. Tiramisu, melon cake, chocolate pudding/cake, coconut cioffin cake. All were good and lasted us a few days. The crepes were so good.

3wfIY4GC5mBTHrgXFj4Y0g.text: A little hidden treat. Smaller selection but everything is oh so good. And it doesn't hurt that the people are nice.

WPg3dKLAT-1ojGOK1BaOGA.text: Savory crepes are very very yummy.  I visited after tasting crepe cake at friend's birthday party.   I ordered puff pastries, BAT and ham crepes, coffee jello, green tea cake and mont Blanc.   I would recommend highly for the mil crepe cake and green tea cake but others were just okay.

JssiBFSkHWB1VkBL1ud22A.text: I tried the custard pudding this morning. It was awesome packed in a small clear glass jar with just enough caramel sauce on the bottom. I cannot wait to try next new stuff over there. Thanx for the good custard pudding

CKCj5C8duxbGnpUFelVtpw.text: I love this place. I hope they never go out of business. Everything- crepes both sweet and savory, pastries (slowly working through the selections which change seasonally), and coffee are always on point.   Blueberry rare cheesecake is a favorite. B.A.T savory crepe also a solid.   Service is awesome and these chefs know what they are doing. I'm so glad they're not on the strip!   Way to go Suzuya!

NgszysIW5Q8T1JMb6eaJDg.text: Crepes was good I had the crunch with strawberries and light whip cream. It was delicious for the price of $4.50. I will definitely come back and try different pastries. The only downfall is they close early 6pm.

GjojNLRZpCgSjokaY-Y82g.text: Best pastries in town! Everything taste amazing and the detail they put into each dessert is nice.

nlbxOs0D-AVIXPQaOkUysA.text: Their blueberry cream cheese crepes are probably the best dessert food I've ever had. Just in the last 2 weeks I've eaten here at least every other day. Soooooo delicious!!!!!

jBSyzGI_go4913mh7HtjzA.text: Best of the best!!!! We love their strawberry cake. It's not sweet like other cakes. Little pricy but worthy!!!

cl-HZWnsUS-EnwT8Wl4MXQ.text: First time here.  I called to see if they were open on Labor Day. I was surprised by how professional the greeting was when the phone was answered.   Green tea cream puff was good, green tea flavor was pronounced. However, I enjoyed the custard cream puff even more. I don't recall the pastry specifically because I really enjoyed the custard since it was so well balanced, not overly sweet or too rich. Good portion size as I don't fancy the giant ones you might be familiar with from a certain franchise.   Blueberry cheesecake was light and fluffy with a slight sour cream undertone. Good, but I prefer the normally dense cheesecakes though.

NmQxeO5zbE2YkbTCVXaNvw.text: Been here many times and always have a great experience. The customer service is wonderful. Their crepe's, both savory and sweet, are amazing! Hands down favorite is the strawberries and cream crepe with fresh strawberries (not frozen or covered in sugary goop) and house made whipped cream! Amazing!! Their savory crepes are delicious as well with house made sauces. Also highly recommend any of their pastries from their display case. Everything is made onsite and not overly sweet. Some of those favorites include cream puffs and tiramisu. Dine in and they have ice water to go with your yummy treats or take it to go and they package everything in either nice pastry boxes or clamshell containers. Highly recommend!!

photos.caption: Photo of SUZUYA Patisserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberries and Whipped Cream Crepe

COyxMLs_YLfXeyRXpdGzEQ.text: I love Suzuya and the Mont Blanc here. It tastes just like the chestnut cakes I would eat as a kid! The desserts here are just right, not too sweet and not too bland. (If you like overly sweet desserts, it's probably not for you.)

yCZAfbEh7csyhSpAf-0mpw.text: Fantastic sweet pastries and crepes! I think that's how you translate their name, anyway. I don't know Japanese.  Their immense reputation certainly precedes them, and I've probably even tried one of their creations at Goyemon a long time ago. But even knowing I would almost certainly enjoy Suzuya, I wasn't motivated to make the drive out until a timely UYE that followed the nearby monthly Chaiya Food Fair today. I'm so, so glad that I finally went.  I ordered the B.A.T. - bourbon bacon, arugula, tomatoes, avocado, house-made mayo, balsamic vinaigrette, all wrapped in a great, almost spongy crepe. This is by far the best savory crepe I've had, and I'd recommend it as a "meal" to precede all your desserts. In terms of sweets, I had a banana-hazelnut cream tart, which I almost absent-mindedly started eating before realizing how good it was. And my other dessert order, a mango mousse, was topped with diced mango and a coconut-dang-it-what's-the-word-Nelson-used? and was heavenly all the way through.  I was also lucky enough to try what Michael K. ordered. I actually started off on those, first taste being a nice piece of apple pie that he requested to be topped with green tea ice cream. To make this delight, they use puff pastry and fuji apple, two of my favorites, and it's quite possibly the best apple pie you'll find around Vegas. I believe that I described this as "really, really good."  I also tasted a bit of a custard atop a thin layer of sponge cake, which was also very good, and practically half a cannoli crepe, which was not overly sweet but still a treat with the ricotta cheese, crunchy pistachio bits and semi-sweet chocolate pieces. Finally, I tried a green tea eclair with a white chocolate topping, and I almost could have had the white chocolate with that touch of green tea powder by itself.  I have a few more treats in my fridge waiting for me to recover from the food coma, and I'm confident that I'll enjoy those as well. (UPDATE 4/30/14: custard pudding awesome, yuzu panna cotta relatively restrained on yuzu flavor.) I won't qualify my recommendation with "sweets" or whatever: Suzuya is a must-try, period.

photos.caption: Photo of SUZUYA Patisserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. In case there was any doubt, check out the real avocado at the crepe station.
Photo of SUZUYA Patisserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mille feuille and green tea cream puff
Photo of SUZUYA Patisserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green tea cake and fruit tart

D13067hCwlfE9RAqLnxCdA.text: When I think of Japanese food usually the first thing that comes to mind is: sushi, sashimi, okonomiyaki, ramen etc. rarely do I ever think of anything sweet.   I heard about this place through a friend who lives close by and read the some reviews, so  I was delighted to see if I can take my sweet tooth craving for a spin. It's cute a little shop and has a pleasant atmosphere, and the staff are nice people too.  I ordered the Mango, Passion Fruit & Coconut Mousse, its unbelievably delicious, I could taste the layers of fruit and surprisingly it wasn't too sweet. I'm a fan strawberries so I had to try the Strawberry Mille Crepe Cake, its stacked crepes formed into a cake, I like this better than any strawberry shortcake.      I love Japanese Milk, tastes like black tea except its cold.  I found out you can buy the powder but I prefer to buy it from a can.  I'm thoroughly impressed with this bakery, I'll definitely be returning back.  .

photos.caption: Photo of SUZUYA Patisserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Japanese Panna Cotta
Photo of SUZUYA Patisserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Japanese Royal Milk Tea with Strawberry Mille Crepe
Photo of SUZUYA Patisserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6sSik_PqMZ13qg4CvLAHLg.text: I'm so sad the crepes are GONE!!!! Everything is great but I'm so freakin' sad!!!!! That savory crepe was the best I've ever had, I'm gonna miss it so much....so much.....

FbTpLfhphNlUCNgwEOVmmw.text: Great pastries and cakes! I've tried their strawberry and green tea crepe cakes as well as their mont blanc cake. Just like the other reviewers say, it is definitely recommended to come earlier as their selection will dwindle down as the day goes by. If you are trying to get a cake made, I recommend calling no later than 2 weeks as they can get busy!

upnbmTnwol9QHoebvpFakA.text: First time visiting the establishment and I do have to say that it was exceedingly pleasant. Upon entering, one is met with a casual ambience coupled with a classy aesthetic. The place felt very comfy and relaxing. Furthermore, the DESSERTS were PALATABLE !!!!  All of the desserts I tried were perfect in sweetness and not overbearing! The presentation for each pastry was exquisite and if you chose to dine in, the dish is accompanied with gold eating utensils. One dish that's worth a mention is the Yuzu Pana Cotta. A miniature dish that PACK-A-PUNCH. It hits with a strong citrus flavor which go hand in hand with a sour jell that sets your taste buds in a frenzy!

photos.caption: Photo of SUZUYA Patisserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SUZUYA Patisserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SUZUYA Patisserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QuqoSrwnLf8zZ7-2rWaCPw.text: Heard about this spot and been wanting to try it, today i finally did. I LOVE crepes and have been on the lookout for a really good crepe spot.  Gotta say, happy I finally found one and close to home.   The crepe was delicious and not too sweet, which is even better. Fresh strawberries and a really creative way of assembling it.  Got to watch them make it from.the start and I was quite impressed. We also tried the eclairs and mini chocolate puffs, delicious!!  The service wasn't amongst the best considering nobody said hello when we walked in even though there were two people working up front, the guy that helped us didn't seem happy at all and we had to wait literally 12 minutes for our crepe AND we were the only ones in the place.   Good thing their pastries and crepes are yumm!!

photos.caption: Photo of SUZUYA Patisserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GY8ygqg8QE7IR6Bwpp1EDQ.text: I found this place yesterday and ABSOLUTELY LOVED IT. So much that I went back today!  The service is great! You're greeted as you walk in and if there is a customer taking their time with their order in front of you the workers apologize for the waiting time which honestly I didn't even mind. They're so friendly and work really hard to explain and describe the food, drinks and pastries. They recognized us right away the second time we went in and patiently waited for us to make up our minds with our order :) The fresh crepes are delicious! We tried both sweet and savory crepes and we were so satisfied! The pastries were amazinggg! From macarons to millicrepes and even the fluffy Tokyo cheesecake! Their tea options surprised me and the way they serve them in the tilt cups is so cute! Salutes to them for the loose leaf teas. Their coffee is smooth and we didn't even need much cream or sugar :) Overall, obviously I love this place and I'll definitely be giving them my business every and anytime I get the chance because I don't even live around the area, haha! :)   Omg wait let's not forget the ambience of the place! Decorated very nicely and the relaxing jazz music is a huuuuuge plus!!

photos.caption: Photo of SUZUYA Patisserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tokyo fluffy cheesecake and savory crepes along with hazelnut hot coffee and Chinese black tea!
Photo of SUZUYA Patisserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm crepes, hot teas, macarons and savory crepes :)

x-wHCqQH-9UH2XpNv_kXZQ.text: Without a doubt the best bakery in town. Has a French-Japanese fusion theme that I've seen in bigger cities. Another such themed cafe, at least in Las Vegas, would probably muck up their menu with gross artificial boba teas and such, but not this place. Everything is seriously delicious.    One quibble: They serve cold brewed coffee and tea that has specially sources beans etc. etc. Basically they seem to care about their coffee and tea. Then, if you want creamer, they only offer those gross dinner cafe creamer things that aren't even made of cream but instead weird chemicals and vegetable oil. Organic specialty brew with bizarre chemical fake dairy product? Just a small detail that could be corrected.

ALBkqOWWVCX87Ia6VGyUiA.text: I wanted to try their Nama chocolate but it was too early.  I had a strawberry shortcake slice to go. The chiffon was soft, complemented by the fresh strawberries and light icing. It lived up to my expectation about Japanese desserts-- light and not entirely sweet!  Will be back to try the rest of their desserts!

LFfGQh6dC_a5hc9f9emQ9A.text: The best most unique and delicate pastries. Strawberry shortcake and coconut are must haves

photos.caption: Photo of SUZUYA Patisserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FWO8fsap_77WbNFkn6rLJQ.text: I was so excited to visit this Japanese style bakery and was not disappointed!!  The cafe itself is small and adorable. They have small selection to choose from (I'm guessing I should get to the bakery earlier for better selection) but the quality is definitely there and visible. We have tried the strawberry shortcake, mango mousse cake, green tea cake roll, and custard pudding. All were delicious!! I have finally found the place that serves Japanese style flan and it is amazing~ Every visit will include one of the custard puddings for sure.  On another visit we had blueberry cheesecake and tiramisu. Personally I did not like the blueberry cheesecake but that was my preference (my boyfriend loved it). The tiramisu, extremely good.  I have yet to try the crepes but they are definitely on the to-eat list.  All in all, wonderful Japanese style pastries. I will be here often and have decided I need to try every dessert they offer!

V2-wpu8tjB3hO3ZZgnVxOg.text: Tried 6 desserts & here are the reviews....millefuielle was my favorite. It's several layers of custard on a puff pastry. The crispy/creamy mixture was heaven in your mouth! Green tea roulade (not pictured because our 2nd time here we couldn't wait for a pic) came in 2nd. It had some candied nuts on the outside and moist cake and redbean & green tea goodness on the inside.   The green tea crepecake was about 13layers...similar filling as the roulade but I got bored with it after a couple bites. Chestnut Mont Blanc was next...if you like the sweet beany, nutty taste of a chestnut get this.  Cheesecake was good, not impressive. Black sesame macaroon(not pictured) was too chewy, I like it on the lighter more delicate, melt in your mouth side.  That being said I'm not quite sure what a macaroon should taste like.   Get the pour coffee! It was strong and went well with all the desserts.

photos.caption: Photo of SUZUYA Patisserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ncFOkofC8Ai0rSrUAWtlQw.text: It was love at first bite. I was in the neighborhood and finally got the chance to check Suzuya out. The place was pretty busy, but luckily that gave me ample time to peruse the display case and figure out what I wanted to order. I couldn't resist the strawberry crepe cake and a red bean cream puff for my fella.   The ordering and payment process is very convenient and I was out the door in minimal time with my adorable little box of desserts. I made it as far as my car before I was compelled to take a bite of the crepe cake. Holy cow! It was absolutely amazing. The flavors were so subtle and yet explosive. The flavors were right on and I can't believe it took me as long as it did to give them a try. I don't have much of a sweet tooth, but this place truly blew my mind. Not overly sweet and the all-natural flavors really shown.   I heard after the fact that the crepe cake is hard to come by, only making me wish I had bought more than one when I had the chance. Have no fear, I will be back... and soon.

Photo of SUZUYA Patisserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Closed feb 17-25, 2014. Reopens feb 26 at 10am.
Photo of SUZUYA Patisserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. :)

4hZg2HFitYPAR_QzI2EIQg.text: I am O B S E S S E D. I live out of state but I visit pretty frequently. This is one of the places have to stop into at least once when I am in town. I've tried a few things there and enjoyed my choices, however my must every time is the strawberries and creme crepe. Simple. But incredible. And delicious!! The ambience of the place is pretty lovely too

photos.caption: Photo of SUZUYA Patisserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. F A V O R I T E!! G. O. A. T.
Photo of SUZUYA Patisserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum!!

mclq3jCoyON1gQ4sX4NUpQ.text: This is my favorite post-dentist visit (ironic, I know). The staff has always been so friendly and helpful. I love the variety of pastries and I always take forever here trying to figure out what to order (cuz the one of everything option isn't always great in real life). I love the mango crepe cake and the cream puffs! I'm not usually s big cream puff fan but the ones here are delicious. I wish I could say I've tried everything but no, I haven't tried everything. It is definitely a life goal, though!

HBB0huCdsGLBO8KQ0PAY2g.text: This place wasn't as great as some others may say. Maybe it might have been the day I went in or the batch that was made at the time? My friend ordered the Tiramisu and off the bat, she said she had way better. I ordered the Strawberry Cheesecake and it wasn't anything I'd be saying "oOooh!" instantaneously to. We are usually so excited to try new dessert places and aren't difficult ones to please, but somehow, this place didn't satisfy our sweet cravings. I gave this place three stars for phenomenal customer service and cleanliness.

1g1y4ri3wMjr383F2X9MHQ.text: Suzuya was one of the first dessert cafes that I bookmarked when I first moved to Las Vegas and finally got the chance to try it when my sisters were in town. We made the trek over there before their flight back home because they wanted to bring some goodies back as souvenirs. There is ample parking in the lot in front of Suzuya. The dessert cafe is very cute and comfortable, just as it would belong in a cute-sy cafe in Japan. My sister asked for two pieces of the cheesecake to go. The lady at the register offered to-go ice packs for the cakes when she found out my sister was taking it onto the place. I thought that was very thoughtful and considerate. Each ice pack costs 50 cents. We ordered the strawberry milli cake to eat there. The milli cake came with a syringe filled with strawberry jam along a set of gold plated utensils. My sister asked for an extra set of utensils for her to-go order, but the lady denied us. I found this to be fairly strange as the utensils were plastic. They weren't real gold or anything close it. As we stuck our fork into the crepe cake, the fork would not let go. The cake was very thick and chewy--an odd consistency for cake. We needed a knife to free up the cake from the fork. Would I come here again, definitely not! Unbookmarked this place as we were leaving the cafe.

photos.caption: Photo of SUZUYA Patisserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry crepe cake
Photo of SUZUYA Patisserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OGJLStaIZbH56juFw8Co0w.text: UNETHICAL BUSINESS PRACTICES ALERT For all those who ordered a cake in advance: make sure you pick it up the day you said you would, if you come in a day later they will not give you your cake or issue a refund! I ordered a cake for thanksgiving and was supposed to pick it up a day before the thanksgiving, but got caught up at work. I called them to inform that I cannot get out of work on time to get the cake, and that I will come to get it the next day (they were open until lunch). The cake was already paid for. I was told that it is impossible, that they cannot give me my cake or a refund the next day. I spoke to the manager, and asked a reason why they cannot give me my prepaid cake before. All I got in response was: "it's our policy, u get it today or get it at all." I ordered cakes from other bakeries and none of them would take advantage of their customers like that, they would happily save the prepaid cake so you can get it a day or two later. But suzuya will resell your prepaid cake the next day because "it's their policy", needless to say will never give them my business again.

oSWpnlpwvcSWiztnGU8qAQ.text: Oh, SUZUYA! This is the place where foodie dessert dreams are fulfilled. From Tokyo Cheesecake to Strawberry Shortcake, and a variety of crepe cakes to their mont blonc, there is something for everyone to enjoy.  It's a quaint space nestled in a small shopping center next to Sonic on Durango and Warm Springs in the Southwest part of town. It's a smaller spot, but there's a coziness to it that is endearing. They offer desserts and coffee, although the coffee is nothing special. What I love about their dessert is that they are as delicious as they are beautifully prepared and presented. You can. Goose to buy by the slice, or they have a. Variety of premade whole cakes ready to go. Otherwise, they take special orders. My favorite thing to get is their original creme puff. The batter is fluffy and airy, and the filling is of real custard and real whipped cream that are both so good and flavorful! They usually come in two sizes and have a variety of flavors from their original to strawberry, and green tea to anko.  From time to time, they have seasonal offerings too, and by far, their best has been their Daifuku Mochi. This is the only place in Vegas I've come across that sells Daifuku Mochi! It's seriously the best dessert I've ever put in my mouth, as there are so many layers to enjoy from the fresh mochi down to the cold strawberry in the middle. Be sure to check out their menu and photos of their offerings. Also, check out their Instagram as they are pretty good at posting what they have readily available for the day, including any seasonal items.

photos.caption: Photo of SUZUYA Patisserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seasonal Ichigo Daifuku Mochi, ladies and gentlemen.

cPkkRksKmyZaDkvmcAEEKg.text: CAKE HEAVEN. This is the ULTIMATE stop for your birthday, Christmas, new year, congratulations, you name it, everyday cake needs. I have yet to find anywhere that beats out SUZUYA cakes.   The first time I had this cake, my brother ordered it for my daughter's second birthday; a delicious Strawberry shortcake. And ever since I have been hooked. The cake is so fluffy... cream looks just like creamy velvet clouds. Did I mention the millie crepe cakes are mouthwatering as well? They kind of have this melt in your mouth taste.   Today I stopped in because I have been dying for some cake. It's the holidays and gosh darn who needs to worry about their diet. I ordered a variety of their cake selection. Strawberry shortcake, strawberry millie cake, green tea and red bean cake, oh and some cute reindeer cream puffs (for the kid). Dare to say I ate almost all of it in one day.... just kidding I did share. But True that we did finish everything in a day.  Everything here is so heavenly. I definitely will not be buying cakes anywhere else. And it's True. I've gotten my daughter's birthday cake from here every year for three years now and my son is hitting two cakes with them. Definitely order ahead if you are needing a cake since the ones in their display seems to sell out. Speaking of which.... time to place an order.   I'm seeing some previous reviews about service. I personally have never ran into bad service here. Every time I have gone, it's been a pleasant Japanese lady working front. She's so quick and efficient. Love it!  Anyways the cakes are a bit pricey and the location is a bit easy to pass. You definitely don't want to miss the chance to try it out though!!

8TLbqTyWe_ZXrJlffDfYQQ.text: This was on my list to go and we finally made it here since we were having lunch a few doors down. This was on the list after reading all the positive reviews. Their website is very clear and organized with great descriptions and pictures of all their cakes looks amazing.   We ordered ~  1) Yuzu Panna Cotta  Yuzu, a refreshing Japanese citrus, flavored yogurt panna cotta.  $3.75  it wasn't panna cotta that we are used to but it was sour and tasty.  2) Chocolate Cream Puff mini  Dark chocolate cream inside with dark chocolate decoration on top  $1.35  It was ok, the perfect amount of sweetness.  3) Custard Pulin   Highest quality vegetarian hen egg custard, with dark caramel sauce on the bottom.  $4.00  This is my fave. Delicious, fresh, and light.  4)Passion Fruit Macaron   Passion fruit butter cream and passion pate de fruit  $2.50/each  This is really good too!

opamLRBaDlO1ulsmwDn1sw.text: I love this place! Asian flavors with French techniques. Everything I have had is excellent. And stunningly beautiful!  If you show up early you can take home a full cake, in case you need a last minute birthday cake. Or they have a large assortment of single-serving treats.  The chocolate cake is delicate and flavorful without being overpowering. The textures are incredible with the soft fluffiness of the cake and the little bits of crunch in the topping. The yuzu panna cotta is light and citrusy, one of my favorites.  Suzuya is a gem!!

XZBcYAmLYjJhJnP1gyzmrQ.text: I think this is a cute place but it didn't meet my expectations. I had the layered strawberry cake. It was good but not that amazing. I think that this place was pretty decently priced but it didn't amaze me. I would recommend it for decent cakes.

qCCcBkTzbECbv50Tjl4JjQ.text: The hubby purchased a strawberry shortcake to celebrate my birthday.  He tried to place an advanced phone order, but missed the deadline and was told to come in to get one first come, first serve while supplies last.    It was Christmas Eve and he arrived 30 minutes before doors opened and was the second person in line.  He mentioned that the line got much longer, also they didn't have many cakes to sell since they had a lot of orders due to the holiday.  So happy with his selection, the cake itself was delicious even though the strawberries was a tad bit overly tart.

photos.caption: Photo of SUZUYA Patisserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gKTYqL1Ef42ZDcuapIKYDg.text: Suzuya is a quaint Japanese style patisserie offering a wide variety of delicious and visually simple yet well crafted pastries and cakes year-round along with special seasonal items. It is a place to sample some of the finest flavors of French-inspired Japanese desserts in the Las Vegas valley.  The taste to sweetness ratio is absolutely perfect among all the items I've tried here. The respective ingredients shine while the sugar accompanies with subtle grace. Like all other cooking styles, this is an art form and these patissiers are great at their craft.   Unfortunately, I haven't had the pleasure of trying all of their baked goods, but I do have my favorites. The strawberry shortcake cannot be missed. It is the shop's signature dessert. The Tokyo cheesecake is such a delight, and like the shortcake, it is light, fluffy, and pure.   I once purchased a whole Tokyo cheesecake for two and never looked back. It's worth it. Trust me.   The rest of patisserie's selection include chocolate cake, mont blanc, panna cotta, tiramisu, mille crepe, cream puffs, a wide range of macarons, and so much more. You'll never run out of things to sample here in one of the best bakeries in town.

Jg2dlLgJacPDBJO61oYl4Q.text: My favorite dessert place in Vegas now. Mont Blanc is sooo good I licked all the cream off the wrap paper. Cream puffs are tasty too. I'm going to come back and try everything.

We ordered a fruit cake. It was aesthetically pleasing. It also tastes really good! It wasn't super sweet, it was the right amount. I have to come back and try all their pastries. It all looked so delicious . Thank you for the great service. The employees were super nice, they showed me the cake before handing it to me to make sure it was correct.

swtS8e-2ckx7L82fx82-Jg.text: I stopped in with a group of fellow Yelpers after a luncheon nearby.  It's a quaint little shop that showcases many lovely pastries.  It is small inside hence not much seating for larger groups.  You can definitely take their treats to go.  Service was ok as it was busy.  Although it did take them a while just to bring out desserts from their case.  That was a little puzzling.  If the flavor matched the beautifully decorated desserts, I'd be writing a completely different review.  Unfortunately I felt a little bit of a let down when it came to biting into the few choices I sampled.  I tried the Coconut Chiffon Cake as well as the Mont Blanc.  Both equally just ok in my book.  I don't know... maybe I just picked the two bland desserts in the case.   I wouldn't be opposed to coming back again to try a crepe or different dessert.  Everyone deserves a second chance.

G6RXeneQxpWPinpNRri6tg.text: Honestly, I have a difficult time getting here early so by the time I arrive, half of the desserts are out. * So a great reminder for those who want all the options is to just come right at opening.*  So far, I have tried the Yuzu panna cotta and it has that distinct citrus flavor. Absolutely delicious. The Mont Blanc threw me off because of the chestnut flavor. It also gave me some flashbacks to French class when we only ever talked about French desserts hahaha. Nonetheless, it was a light but enjoyable little cake. But the one dessert that steals my heart is the green tea crepe cake. The dessert is delicate and not as sweet as you would expect. It's also the one that I find to disappear first :-((  I do buy a box full of desserts for my family from time to time, and they just love everything I bring back. The cream puffs are usually a total hit.

Om1_bX3oImAg2ldDqqpmaw.text: My husband ordered me a micro crepe cake for my birthday and in my favorite flavor, green tea. It is one of those most amazing cakes I've ever eaten on my birthday. Wow!!!!  On other occasions I've been given green tea creams puffs and their cake roll. This place is a hidden gem and I haven't even tasted the entire menu. I'm in love.

lJBzLXOT7M163hEXOX4flg.text: Dropped in yesterday hoping to find a last minute  birthday cake at closing time. To my surprise there was a perfect chocolate mousse cake decorated with chocolate curls. They even personalized a buttery crisp cookie with my son's name on it for a modest charge. Everything in the case looked sooooo delicious we ended up taking a few extra pastries which were all amazingly constructed: decadent without being overly sweet and the textures were divine!!! Don't leave without a coffee ice cream float!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of SUZUYA Patisserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum!!!!

thPdK1WkXpzO-GkZtvQ1iw.text: I love that Suzuya is right around the corner from me because I know that I'm never too far from delicious, fresh baked goods.   I hate the Suzuya is right around the corner from me because I usually order too much stuff for two people (me and my husband). I have to space my visits apart to ensure I don't have to regularly buy new (bigger) pants.   Though I've visited twice on the way home from work, it's best to arrive at or close to opening to ensure the widest selection possible. Whatever time you come, rest assured that the pastry will be flaky, the custard creamy and flavorful, the presentation cute AF, and the service friendly and attentive.   My personal favorites are the yuzu pana cotta, strawberry mille crepe, cream puffs and millefeuille. The latter is flaky pie dough layered with vanilla custard cream. The pastry is buttery and perfectly crisp.  All of the cream puffs are well done, but I especially enjoy the strawberry and chocolate flavors. The filling on the chocolate cream puff is reminiscent of a quality chocolate ice cream, but stuffed into pastry. What's not to love? You also can't go wrong with the matcha selections. Duh.   One should keep in mind:  - This is an Asian-influenced bakery. Don't expect something over-creamy, over-saccharine, or over-anything. What makes the treats here so great is that they're balanced or, as all my aunts would put it, "they're sweet, but not too sweet."  - Parking is shared with Jiffy Lube. Watch out for those maniacs speeding through looking for an oil change   - The cafe area is small, but super cute.  - There's a loyalty program now, which means my gluttony will now be rewarded. So long, current pants...   I have yet to try to coffee or crepes, but I can't imagine they'd be any less enjoyable than everything else.

Their pastries are delicious, freshly made, and not super sweet --- so I don't feel too guilty eating them! Their stuff sold out very early ('cause they are freshly made!) because they have a lot of fans so get there early if you want to have a variety of choices to choose from!

0WP81MpyAtBqvjxV1L1LFg.text: Great place. Prices were great and reasonable. Under $5 for a crepe is fantastic. My only complaint is that we ordered three creeps and they all came out at the same time and mine was cold. Flavor wise this was just as good as JP at Bellagio.

1zeVQgmdRvhsZ1BDicw4KQ.text: Love this place! The cakes are delicate and delish. I especially loved the tofu cheesecake, crepes, monte blanc and cream puffs. The staff is super friendly and helpful.  A definite go back to kind of place.

J3jQ2oeb6SoMI_t3WYKT7A.text: I tried the green tea cake but I didn't particularly care for it. I did love the coconut chiffon cake and the chocolate cake my husband had.  Their stuff is not overly sweet yet really good. I will go back and I do recommend them.

WWg7ZORf5tVLi1b8FLW-CA.text: Fundamentally a great place to either start or end your day. This place brings me back to the good old days where I would spend my time walking up and down Sawtelle Blvd. in west L.A. for a crepe or pastry. this place is just as small as any Japanese storefront, so it's as authentic as it can be.  Great job on brining more culture to our town!!

R9XGn0iFcG-yXfaNR_cNsQ.text: Amazing pastries we tried a little of everything and really liked the vanilla cream puffs, strawberry shortcake, and custards.

9cU9O0TZQABj8iuBgQXzBQ.text: I think they are new as I just found them.  Visited with hopes this bakery would be close to the bakeries we frequented while living in Japan.  Bakery has a very limited selection of pastries and treats.  What we tried was very good but very expensive.  Many of the treats we consider standard fare at a Japanese bakery are not available here.  With the high price and limited selection, its just okay.  Will try back in a few months time to see if they have expanded their selection and lowered pricing.

Yir6JGpNK9Cz56ldbZGqtg.text: I kind of want to keep this place to myself but couldn't stop raving about it. 5 star no doubt! For sure coming back to feed my sweet tooth every time I visit Vegas! Yes, it's THAT good :) Typical Japanese level of sweetness, doesn't get you disgusted after finishing 3 desserts (yeah I actually finished 3 of those, with some help lol ). The savory crepe is also to die for, we ordered the B.A.T and it has plenty greens, delicious and healthy. The three desserts we ordered were the strawberry millecrepe cake, green tea cake and apricot custard crepe. Both strawberry and green tea cakes were perfect, I personally like their millecrepe better than lady M's , a little bit less creamy and less sweet. The apricot has the little bit of sourness that my tongue's not used to. Next time I would like to try their ham cheese savory crepe , cheese cake, cream puff, millefeuille, pudding ... Oh I'm just gonna keep coming back to try everything. Forgot to mention, their coffee!

cifqbCpctmPcF4mSuCKlqQ.text: So glad I discovered this place! Cream puffs were yummy. Crepes are good, but wish had more variety. Very friendly young gentleman who worked the counter. Tried the matcha cake - matcha was too strong and didn't finish it.  Only tried a few pieces  but can't wait to try more.

_2GnMCsRCIAd3eStPK79_w.text: ......Simply hands down the best pastry in town.  In every bite, I felt  a thoughtful harmony of the fresh ingredients.  If you want to indulge your appetite for the serious desserts like the ones from the star-studded upscale restaurants, this is the place for you.  Not for people who think over-sugared everything is desert.

It's not "cheap" but you get what you pay for with real butter, fresh baked daily and a super clean kitchen.

zbkevFEvtqbOI8JqlRmupw.text: I have loved Suzuya for over a year and I'm just now writing this!   Almost everything I have tried has been delicous! The custard, yuzu panna cotta, fresh peach jelly with panna cotta, strawberry short cake, cream puffs, mango or strawberry mille crepe cake, eclairs, and their apple pie. The crepes!  Holy moly I am ruined for life. Their crepes have the PERFECT texture and taste awesome. But when you fill them with fresh strawberry jam or make it a cannoli crepe with ricotta filling and pistachios mmm. They are taken to a whole nother level. Our family favorite is Nutella and bananas, super creative huh ;)  I highly recommend Suzuya for anyone who's looking for a dessert that is packed with flavor but not heavy!

The coffee taste was not overwhelming like other ones I've tasted. It was well balanced My friend ordered the strawberry crepe cake which was quite refreshing. It was definitely the best tiramisu I've had in a while.  The way the desserts were presented was very neat and clean. The bakery is well maintained and clean as well. I wish they were open longer though.

eYbE0rVUbWGKgabgQSBH3g.text: Oh my goodness! Suzuya has many items to offer! I reccommend coming early when they open when they have more selection because close to closing time a lot of their items are sold out. Some of my friends bought me sweets here for a birthday treat. I loved all of the delicious cakes they gave me! I came here recently with my niece and it was the first time coming to the actual shop. It is a really cute little cafe-like enviornment. They have a section to get water, which are served in glasses rather than plastic cups like most other places. When eating in, I got the rare blueberry cheesecake and a passion fruit macaroon. The cheesecake was so fluffy and the berries were not sour at all like most blueberries I encounter. The macaroon was just so amazing. I was sad when I ate it all.  My niece got the green tea macaroon which she said was delicious. She also got some sort of strawberry crepe cake.  They also serve crepes which I have not tried yet but I will next time!

3OqiccqFrlSJRHQBFHMyhA.text: This review is not for the pastries in the bakery, but their pre-ordered cakes! I ordered a birthday crepe cake for a friend of mine while we were staying in Vegas. The price wasn't too bad, I believe the cake came out to be a total of $46, but it was a little over $50 with tax. Again, this was a crepe cake, so it's definitely a bit more pricey than a normal cake. I recommend eating it as soon as you can, and not letting it sit for long!

7QFTwMG_vjJPLzpyN7iOMg.text: I have been here twice, ONLY because I don't live remotely nearby. Otherwise, I'd come all the time!  My first visit was for my 27th birthday and I had a chocolate cream puff (fantastic flavor) and cake roll with fruit (gorgeous and delicious). My second visit was to pick up a chocolate cake for my husband's and my first wedding anniversary. It was $25 for a 6-inch cake, but like all their desserts, it was flawless, impeccable, and tasted great, not to mention it was piled high with chocolate shavings. If you want a dessert that's delicate, tasty, and gorgeously executed, this is your place.

u-XrIyoxZuKsE0JscGPscQ.text: Good japanese italian bakery by the wonderful Miss Suzu. (hence the name Suzuya. "Suzu" + "ya = shop)   freshly made items daily.   My most recent visit was after the monthly Chaiya Monastery Food Festival with other yelpers. I had ordered the mont blanc (usual favorite item to get) and by recommendation of Nelson and Sylvia, i got the custard pudding as well.   If you dine in, they'll put your dishes on a japanese style tray, with utensils. Payment is easy through their mounted square system.   Custard Pudding - very smooth and creamy. Not too sweet. Have a sauce on the bottom, similar to one with a flan. great combination. forms a wonderful medley of flavors   Mont Blanc - a dessert that is wonderfully prepared. whipped cream in the center, with piped lines of super aromatic, flavorful chestnut paste-like cream around forming the exterior. topped with a perfectly peeled sweet chestnut.   I've tried a few other desserts as well but not too fresh in my mind. XD But nothing has disappointed me yet. All are prepared wonderfully with an italian taste with a japanese flare. Not too sweet. Even my mom loves it !

photos.caption: Photo of SUZUYA Patisserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mont blanc and custard pudding

Pan73fOyOxZ5ZQqLrIatBA.text: I love here because when visit here, my feeling is as if I were in Japan. All cake makes me feel nostalgic. Of course tastes too. I'm always go there around 5PM,so already they've few cakes.. So I should be there more early time for try all kind of cakes.  I think cream puff is just average, it isn't special puff, because we've lots of more delicious puff in Japan. Mont Blanc and Kabocha pie and green tea mille crepes and Mille-feuille is my favorite so far. Especially Mille-feuille is amazing!! I've never try their crepes yet, so I'll try it soon. Maybe the price is slightly high but worth to eat their cakes.

Photo of SUZUYA Patisserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roll cake:) Delicious!

CSKJOOv6eoD-ARMmQKktjw.text: I'm with Vanessa- heard so many great things about this place that I expected them to blow my mind, but found that it was just okay. Maybe better than okay, as they have some very unique flavors, but for what I got I just wasn't wowed.  Coffee menu is small, service is very personable but a bit on the slow side. Opted for the ako cream puff (chef special) and green tea eclair (chef favorite). Both were very light, which I appreciated as I am not much of a sweet tooth. But the dough for both seemed to be the same, overall just seemed very similar despite my effort to try two different items- should have gone for the yuzu pana cotta as I initially wanted, but thought that would be piggish of me.  Super sweet cashier, beautiful desserts and cakes. Will have to return for the yuzu pana cotta and an iced green tea on a hot day. Or a savory crepe for lunch, they sound delish!  Side note for first time visitors: it's in the same plaza as Fish N Bowl, signage just says "Pastries and Crepes", NOT Suzuya.

photos.caption: Photo of SUZUYA Patisserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Akko cream puff (red bean), green tea eclair

tKo_tmXMu6cImi7Ua30kFg.text: This is my favorite bakery in town!! Especially since the desserts aren't overly sweet, their desserts are something even my parents can enjoy with me. I'm always willing to drive out of my way to get desserts from here. The place itself is a little small, so I usually grab for to-go.  STRAWBERRY SHORTCAKE: IF YOU'RE A FIRST TIMER, TRY THIS!!! The strawberry shortcake is one of suzuya's signature desserts. It's not only super cute, but it's not overbearingly sweet. The whipped cream has a very nice fluffy and velvety texture to it which adds a nice touch. Usually I don't eat all of the whipped cream on cakes but this cake is an exception. The cake portion of it is very airy and soft - perfect. The sponge cake is the star of every cake, it's what makes or breaks it. 3 thumbs up for suzuya!! I've actually gotten the strawberry shortcake done as several of my birthday cakes and all of my guests ALWAYS asked where I got it from.   ICHIGO DAIFUKU: Right now, they have their seasonal ichigo daifuku which is a Japanese mochi stuffed with whipped cream, red bean, and a strawberry. I also think that everybody can agree that Suzuya has THE BEST strawberries in town. I don't get how - but you can't even get strawberries this fresh at the market. I'm convinced it's just the bakery magic. As of right now I haven't been able to find any other place that sells ichigo daifuku, but you should definitely try it at least once! It's kind of $$$ since it's $5 for one, but I'd say to try it at least once!! I've even bought some for my friends to try because it's just that good (rip my wallet is crying).   BLUEBERRY RARE CHEESECAKE: This cheesecake is special because it's actually a non baked cheesecake! I only had a bite of this since it was for my sibling, but it's very light, airy, and melts in your mouth!! You can taste the fresh blueberry for sure. This is more of a traditional cheesecake as opposed to the fluffy Tokyo cheesecake.   TIRAMISU: The cream is very soft, light, and everything a tiramisu should be. Personally, I'm not the biggest fan of tiramisu so I didn't eat much of it, but my sibling recommends it. It has a pretty strong coffee flavor if you're into that!

photos.caption: Photo of SUZUYA Patisserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. from top to bottom: strawberry shortcake, blueberry rare cheesecake, tiramisu and ichigo daifuku - to go
Photo of SUZUYA Patisserie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. strawberry shortcake

puQ2gL-9Kn-5DEvpx-W1YA.text: Mood- pastries  Upon entering everyone was all smiles and so inviting. I knew by the display case I was grabbing a couple of desserts and of course some tea.   I opted for the tiramisu, strawberry creme crepe cake, and nitro hibiscus tea. Can I say that crepe cake was absolutely wonderful? I think I may need to order a whole entire cake of that. The tiramisu was good. .   Interior is a couple of tables, and there is outdoor seating as well. This place really isn't meant for a large groups.  I would def recommend- pricing is a reflectionof quality and presentation. I will be back to order a whole cake.   Location is Durango/ Warm Springs - ample parking

lh0ofayA2nCo2EtfBAKefQ.text: Having heard of all the delicious goodness that is made at this bakery for many years, the family and I finally made time to make a visit! Although we've made efforts to cut substantial amounts of sugar out of our diet, we indulge on occasion when the cravings come and we were certainly not disappointed  We ordered the Tokyo Cheesecake(My Favorite), Green Tea Cake and Mont Blanc.   Admittedly, I expected to be a little overwhelmed with all the sugar after having deprived myself of it. Fortunately, I was pleasantly surprised at the subtle but well balanced sweetness that complimented the unique flavors of each dessert.   I was able to pick a favorite simply because I'm a sucker for cheesecake but I highly recommended all three  Can't wait to return for our next 'cheat day'!  PS - there were a number of sold out items when we arrived just before closing. A proper assumption for a place like this can only mean one thing - so get there early for the good stuff!

CKyDRgcGOg_Giw4Yjy_ygw.text: No doubt. Cakes here were all great. Their best selling Tokyo Cheesecake reminds me home in Japan. Hence, Blueberry cheesecake was always my favorite all time. I had a nostalgic feel. Flavors are on point.  The lady here greeted us with the proper  the minute we came in. Only one star out for their coldbrew coffee float. 4FZUoiSOYOQkRYROs7CvSg.text: Upon reading amazing reviews, I had very high expectations for Suzuya Patisserie. Unfortunately, I was left with a subpar experience. In fairness, I should probably preface my review by stating that ever since traveling to Japan, nothing is the same.   Upon entering, Suzuya is very pleasing to the eye. It is a simple, modern, and clean bakery that offers a comfortable setting. There are very few places to sit - I noticed majority of the customers took orders to go.   The gentleman at the counter was very nice and willing to answer any questions. However, two minutes after I walked in, it started getting busy and he seemed very flustered. I noticed a job posting on the door so I assumed they were understaffed.   As for the desserts on their own, in my opinion, it was nothing more than just okay. The Tokyo Cheesecake has a decent flavor and sweetness to it - however, the cheesecake on it's own had a ricotta-cheese type texture. Far from the soft traditional cheesecake that I am used to. The green tea cream puff had a delicious green tea filling. It was a perfect sweetness to match the flavor of the green tea. The puff seemed over done.  Overall, I would say it was just an average experience. I wouldn't go out of my way to stop in again.

lokq0tPDgyFSX2j0Yba_2g.text: The desserts here are 100% amazing! First time I came here with my boyfriend we ordered 3 cakes, they tasted like heaven. Second time we actually got 4 just for the two of us! Lol the prices are fair with the portions. The utensils are cute too. Coffee not so much, I'm a coffee lover and I've tasted better coffee.

fRS8KYrME8vGrdBGZFPGSA.text: Love love love!!!! I like this place because the cakes here are not too sweet! The cheese cake is really great . I will be back!

sKUF4b3sxap1scMxxstm4g.text: It's all about the Strawberry Shortcake!!   So I first came here a long time ago and tried their Green Tea Cake, but thought that it tasted weird. Didn't come back until earlier this year. Bought a 6" Strawberry Shortcake and absolutely loved it! Soft, light, not too sweet and very nicely decorated. Strawberries are also one of my favorite fruits. It was very delicious, and I could probably eat this for dessert every day!     The Chocolate Cake was pretty good because it wasn't heavy and overly sweet like what I am used to. Haven't had much luck with the other cake slices that I tried from here. The Tokyo Cheesecake was the worst - it was dry and very bland. Took a few bites and tossed it in the trash. The Blueberry Rare Cheesecake was creamy, but I didn't like the glaze/sauce that they put on it. Tasted really sour.   Their whole cakes are great for special occasions, gifts and a treat for yourself. Sometimes there is a line outside the store right before they open. The other day, I was 3rd in line and the two customers before me also bought the Strawberry Shortcake. It's their best seller for sure! They can also reserve cakes and take payments over the phone for same day pick up. The ladies that work here are very polite and from the looks of it, they have been really busy this holiday season.   Love it! I'll be back soon for sure!

uUfg1Ly8CcDUCamQDNKhFg.text: 5 starts for the food , 4 for the service.  Had to come here to try the Tokyo cheesecake. I keep hearing about this light and fluffy food item of bliss and it lives up to the hype.   When in a rush I got 2 macaroons, 1 tokyo cheesecake slice and a barley tea.   Love the barley tea it is light and has a unique flavor. I love it.   The tokyo cheesecake is a lite and fluffy cheesecake. Honestly it taste like 70% of a NY cheesecake.  About 70% as sweet and dense. The price is also reasonable.   The macroons are nice just at $2.50 each they are a tad pricey.   Service could be improved.

K9Mpw8GiJUDXYwSs95Dt1w.text: Cute as a kitty little Asian style boutique desserts. Constant flow of patrons. Pretty 1 big glass display cake case filled w/special and difficult to make delights. Not the usual or special doughnuts here. More macaroons, mini cakes, large specialty cakes and things with whipped cream. Green tea is a common string of flavors here.  Some outdoor red umbrella seatings and some 2 person and 1 bench seats inside.  Liked the gold plastic utensils they give you.  Lots of parking.

t1oSdKFuqi45fQaQFeVQDA.text: Fresh, Homemade, and High Quality ingredients are the basis for all their desserts. Suzuya is a sophisticated Japanese Pastry shop where you can order from a display of fresh made cakes, macaroons, and pastries.   I ordered the blueberry cheesecake, mini pumpkin pie, Tokyo Cheesecake, and the Earl Grey Macaron. The thing I love about all their desserts is that none of them are overly sweet (like most Asian styled desserts) and the sweetness that is there comes from natural ingredients never artificial.   The blueberry cheesecake was light, smooth and tart. Their mini pumpkin pie was delicious with real pumpkin puree. The Tokyo cheesecake was fluffy and airy. The macaron was a generous size and individually wrapped. I loved the vast variety of macaron flavors which included flavors like red bean and passion fruit, among others.   I was also able to try their Cold Brew Coffee, and it was rich, complex and delicious. Even a coffee connoisseur spoke very highly of their coffee too. There is some seating indoors and outdoors, ample parking outside, and super friendly and quick service. 5 stars all the way!

L8XvJ2BRhSzUG37dCJ2Z3Q.text: I'm not much of a dessert person...yet I love everything from Suzuya Patisserie! They are delicate, soft, delicious and never overly sweet...just sweet enough for you to day-dream about later on.   I've ordered full cakes from here on many occasions, including birthday cakes and just-because cakes. There are a variety of small, personal sized, pastry and dessert treats as well so you don't have to commit to one big cake...but I'm sure you won't regret it if you go big. You need to give a couple of days advance notice for your cake to ensure you will get exactly what you want... Though they seem to make a few each day so can always push your luck and see if something is available when you come.   There are a handful of exceptional Japanese dessert restaurants in town, such as Sweets Raku, and for sure Suzuya Patisserie is one of my top 3. Love what they're doing here!  -2018 review #21-

K6e8I2ErGFqSH543wv7Hdw.text: I was expecting this to be a sit-down and enjoy your dessert type of bakery, but its actually very small. There are only a few tables so it caters more to take-home dessert orders. Still there's a big pastry display case with lots of single sliced cakes and other desserts like yuzu panna cotta. Everything looked perfect - like it wasn't even real.   I called in to order an 8'' strawberry shortcake for my boyfriend's bday. The person I spoke to was really nice and made the process easy. I had to drive across town to pick up the cake during my lunch break and it was quick even though there were quite a few people coming in to order. The ladies behind the counter were pleasant to everyone despite being busy. The cake was delicious and my whole family loved it. It was light, fluffy, and not overly sweet. The coffee is also good!   I basically want to try all the cake and desserts on display here!!!

Fbpn2FtXw3Pwxb0y_JHlfA.text: 5 stars for excellently crafted desserts that match its superb taste. Creamy, dreamy and delightful.  The menu varies from day to day and is aesthetically designed by pastry chef, Suzuya. Her talents originate from Japanese decedent desserts.   My favorite is the cream puff; its smooth, light and beautifully flaky...delicious! The coffee float is a mix of bitter sweet. The ice cream is coated with shoyu caramel; it is sweet and filling. The coffee puts in the bite. The mixture is oddly satisfying.    This place is definitely a must try. I shall return!

8b1ydXzBqpYiCixC9QYcGA.text: The ichigo daifuku and mango mochi is so delicious. When I picked up the piece to eat, it felt so delicate and precious. The ichigo was light and the fresh strawberry with the cream and sweetness from red bean is wonderful. The mango mochi was perfect and each bite was like mango heaven. The mochi was thin and just the right amount to go with the light taste of the mango.

jJ3NbbhPBxIMjkOzTQqJsg.text: So I wasn't sure what to expect trying this bakery. I'm quite impressed. Not only were the desserts so neat and tidy in the case but they had so much flavor to offer. The bakery was nice and orderly and we were welcomed as we entered. There isn't much seating but it was fine because it wasn't overly crowded. The desserts aren't abundantly sweet yet still desirable. The flavors seemed to come out more in that sense.   We ordered a Tokyo cheesecake and Mont Blanc to chow down on inside and some pumpkin cream puffs and Macarons to go. The cheesecake was heaven, so light and tall. I wish I could have had the whole thing to myself. The Mont Blanc was interesting. It had a lot of different flavors and textures going on. The almond tart on the bottom was superb, so delicious! I really liked the sponge cake as well. The cream puff didn't lack in tasting like pumpkin spice but more sweetness would have been nice.   Now the macarons! Incredible! My favorite macarons in town for sure. Bursting with flavor and the texture was spot on. I could have just ordered a tray of those and been content. The passion fruit was my favorite followed closely by the chocolate raspberry, although all the ones we got were so good! They're unlike any macaron I've had. They were each neatly wrapped. I must go back for more.   SUZUYA was worth the drive across town.

juCkQQJja7xgAnIfY6kFRg.text: This is where to go for real-life anime food. The Japanese-French pastries are so light and airy, and they're not too sweet at all. They have many different varieties of different foods. My favorite is the mont blanc. The chestnut flavor really shines through, and the chestnut on top is oddly nostalgic. I have yet to try the crepes or the drinks, but I hope to next time I stop by. The matcha crepe cake is also light with deep flavor.   My only complaint is the short hours, but it's understandable that they close early because these desserts go quick. The prices are reasonable; you definitely get your money's worth.

3j5c_6tjk_w-oqk2UtgYEQ.text: We went here for our after lunch dessert yesterday 3/28 and they have a large selection of desserts. I had the layered green tea & anko mille crepe with red bean in it. It wasn't too sweet but tasted good. I took home the blueberry rare cheesecake and strawberry shortcake. I had a tasting of the blueberry cheesecake today and it wasn't heavy like normal cheesecakes because it wasn't baked but it tasted delicious. My son had the strawberry shortcake and I had a bite of it and it was lite and airy but still delicious also. They do have drinks also that they serve. The service there was great. The place is small with just a few tables to sit on. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone for after lunch/dinner dessert for their variety of desserts. They also have a large selection of macaroons. I will definitely go here again and take my family and friends here.

Lp0dUllXXZevbhgW2jQ8hg.text: best pastries in town. not too sweet just right. the apple pie certainly is my favorite. i wish they have specialty coffees though :-(

M0sScrO3b6NOhskjLLFcwA.text: I love how their cakes are not too sweet, they're just right. I also love their crepes~! Savory or sweet, they make them delicious. :D
